intro: Senecio capcirensis, commonly known as the Cape York senecio, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It features narrow, linear leaves and produces small yellow flowers in clusters. Senecio capcirensis is often found in coastal and mountainous regions, where it thrives in well-drained conditions.
